discussion.content: B - It quickly returns results from the summarized data, and returns results more slowly from the raw, unsummarized data that exists outside of the data model summary range.

choices.A: Returns results from only non-summarized data.
choices.B: Returns results from both summarized and non-summarized data.
choices.C: Prevents use of wildcard characters in aggregate functions.

questions.question_text: What does using the tstats command with summariesonly=false do?

choices.C: index=summary search_name="Linux logins" | stats count by src_ip user
choices.D: index=summary sourcetype="linux secure" | stats count by src_ip user
choices.B: index=summary search name="Linux logins" | top src ip user

questions.question_text: A report named "Linux logins" populates a summary index with the search string sourcetype=linux secure | sitop src ip user. Which of the following correctly searches against the summary index for this data?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B is the correct answer.
https://docs.splunk.com/Documentation/Splunk/latest/SearchReference/Sitop
Please ignore my previous comment, It is B. It also states it needs to be filtered by the top IP user.
It is C. I have verified it by myself.

Selected Answer: C
Correct answer is C. The name of the report should be the value for the field search_name. See Splunk Fundamentals 3 slide 220.

comments.content: the same slide deck you mention shows the answer at page 225. if you're using | sitop to create an summary you would search | top

questions.question_text: Which of the following is accurate about cascading inputs?

choices.B: The final input has no impact on previous inputs.
choices.A: They can be reset by an event handler.
choices.C: Only the final input of the sequence can supply a token to searches.
choices.D: Inputs added to panels can not participate.

comments.content:
A, reason: event handler to reset a menu when another menu is changed
Final input does affect the previous inputs. Reference, Splunk video: Click on first input shows the list of players, who played game X. When clicking on a player for game X, will show Player Y's game list

discussion.content:
No, its B.
Event handlers are used to trigger actions based on user interactions, such as clicking a button or selecting a value from a dropdown. While event handlers can be used to reset the value of an input, they cannot be used to reset the value of a cascading input sequence.

Selected Answer: B
Simple XML Reference - Splunk Documentation

questions.question_text: What is the correct hierarchy of XML elements in a dashboard panel?
When possible, what is the best choice for summarizing data to improve search performance?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Data model acceleration

Selected Answer: D
Summary indexing is designed to improve search performance by precomputing and storing summarized data in a separate index. This allows you to run searches on the smaller, summarized dataset rather than the full raw data, significantly speeding up search times.

Selected Answer: B
Correct answer is B. Data model acceleration is the easiest and most efficient acceleration option and should be your first choice. From Splunk Fundamentals 3 slide 230.
